title: High Public Sector Transparency
description: In 2023, Cape Verde achieved a CPIA transparency, accountability, and corruption rating of 4.5, indicating a strong commitment to public sector integrity.

title: Efficient Public Administration
description: Cape Verde's public administration quality was rated 4 out of 6 in 2023, reflecting a well-functioning governmental framework.

title: Minimal Ores and Metals Exports
description: In 2023, ores and metals accounted for only 0.000058% of Cape Verde's merchandise exports, highlighting a limited reliance on these resources.

title: Low Cereal Yield
description: Cape Verde's cereal yield was 11.5 kg per hectare in 2022, one of the lowest globally, indicating challenges in agricultural productivity.

title: Limited Patent Applications
description: In 2021, Cape Verde had just 1 patent application from nonresidents, suggesting limited innovation and foreign interest in intellectual property.

title: Significant Coal Rent Contribution
description: Coal rents contributed 17.18% to Cape Verde's GDP in 2021, indicating a substantial reliance on coal-related activities.

title: Children Living with HIV
description: In 2022, there were 100 children aged 0-14 living with HIV in Cape Verde, reflecting ongoing public health challenges.
